Description:
As a Senior Accountant, you will play a crucial role in managing financial operations and ensuring accuracy and efficiency in our accounting processes. YoResponsibilities:Manage accounts payable processes, including vendor invoice verification, recording and processing invoices, and coordinating payments.
Oversee petty cash management, including reconciling and replenishing petty cash funds, and maintaining accurate records.
Conduct inventory control activities, such as monitoring stock levels, performing regular audits, and reconciling inventory records.
Prepare and review bank reconciliations to ensure accurate and timely processing of financial transactions.
Collaborate with internal departments to resolve any accounting discrepancies and ensure accurate financial reporting.
Assist in month-end and year-end closing procedures, including preparing financial statements and supporting schedules.
Participate in financial audits and provide necessary documentation and information to auditors.
Stay updated with relevant accounting regulations, standards, and best practices to ensure compliance.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. Professional certifications (e.g., CPA, ACCA) are preferred.
Proven work experience as a Senior Accountant or similar role, preferably in a facilities management or related industry.
Proficient in using accounting software and MS Office applications, particularly Excel.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
